wikipedia_page.main: William Paul (5 August 1868 – 3 August 1932) was a Scottish footballer who played as a full back.

response: Bill, Billy, Willie, or William Paul may refer to:
* William Paul (MP), British MP for Windsor, 1710–1711
* William Paul (attorney) (1885–1977), Alaskan politician and attorney
* William Paul (Australian politician) (1846–1947), New South Wales politician
* William Paul (British politician) (1884–1958), also known as Bill, socialist politician
* William Paul (New Zealand politician) (1875–1942), New Zealand politician
* William Paul (judoka), American who participated in Judo at the 1967 Pan American Games
* William Paul (bishop) (1599–1665), Bishop of Oxford and Dean of Lichfield
* William Paul (minister) (1754–1802), a minister of the Church of Scotland
* William Paul (died 1773), older brother of John Paul Jones
* William Paul (1754–1802), Chaplain in Ordinary in Scotland to King George III of the United Kingdom

William Paul (7 February 1866 – 23 October 1911) was a Scottish footballer who played for Partick Thistle and Scotland as a centre forward. He was capped three times by Scotland and scored five goals (including four in one match in 1890). He featured for Partick Thistle across three decades, with his statistics in competitive matches for the club standing at 127 goals in 218 appearances.
